Heteromeles arbutifolia is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that is well-adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native range, which includes California, Oregon, and Baja California. It is often used in landscaping and xeriscaping due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.

The plant's berries have been an important food source for various indigenous peoples in its native range, and it has also been used for medicinal purposes. Heteromeles arbutifolia plays a vital role in the local ecosystem, providing food and shelter for a variety of wildlife species.
